data.title: BasicEffect / Model processor Lighting issues
data.body:
Hello there,

I encountered a few issues with the lighting features of the BasicEffect and its relation to the Model Processor of MonoGame.
1. The BasicEffect lighting does not seem to apply correct (tested with the EnableDefaultLighting), it just casts the same light on all parts of the model, ignorning direction. This might be directly related to 
2. The Model Processor seems to somehow mess up normals of the model (or something else related to lighting, I am not sure). This causes light applied by the BasicEffect to look the same for the entire model and appear black.

I have an illustration of this occurence here, compared to XNA's output:
![wxpsjlt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2119926/9210458/b9a0efe4-407c-11e5-82c2-47c3adb501ec.png)

(Also, on that note, GraphicsDeviceManager.PreferMultiSampling does not seem to prefer multi sampling, it is activated on all models on those screenshots above, but does not seem to apply in MonoGame [yes, GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges() has been called]).

data.title: Windows 10 BaseStream avoidance
data.body: We should no longer call BinaryReader/Writer.BaseStream as it has a huge overhead on UWP

data.title: Fixed WP8 Texture2D.SaveAsJpeg with different resolution
data.body: We have been using the wrong height and width for almost two years now. If your target size did not match the original size, the method would fail.

data.title: Updates for UWP NuGet package
data.body:
This requires NuGet 3.1 available here:

http://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v3.1.0-beta/nuget.exe

More info on these changes here:

http://blog.nuget.org/20150729/Introducing-nuget-uwp.html

data.title: Content Pipeline does not open file
data.body:
I'm not able to open an mgcb file in the content pipeline.  Opening the tool and going to file open yields a blank window.  This issue does not occur on my Windows 7 machine using the same file.

Windows 8.1
Monogame 3.4

![content pipeline bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1524901/9152720/b1293c40-3e01-11e5-9920-2d5327fe2eb9.png)

data.title: Android screen auto rotation problem
data.body:
Hi. I have an android app with multiple activities and one of them(not main) is AndroidGameActivity with monogame game. 
All works fine but it does not seems to react on device or emulator gets rotated. Native android views rotates without any problems. 
My Activity setup

```
[Activity (
    Label = "GameActivity", 
    ScreenOrientation = ScreenOrientation.Portrait | ScreenOrientation.Landscape, 
    LaunchMode = LaunchMode.SingleTask,
    AlwaysRetainTaskState = true,
    ConfigurationChanges = ConfigChanges.Orientation | ConfigChanges.Keyboard | ConfigChanges.KeyboardHidden)]          
public class GameActivity : Microsoft.Xna.Framework.AndroidGameActivity
```

And in the game constructor i've set theese properties for the graphics

```
graphics = new GraphicsDeviceManager (this);
Content.RootDirectory = "Content";              
graphics.IsFullScreen = false;  
graphics.SupportedOrientations = DisplayOrientation.Portrait | 
    DisplayOrientation.LandscapeLeft |
    DisplayOrientation.LandscapeRight | 
    DisplayOrientation.PortraitDown;
```

If I set only Landscape it works fine, but it just can't switch between Portrait and landscape. Did I missed some thing?
Thanks.

data.title: Template misplacement for Visual Studio 2015.
data.body:
Hello there,

the MonoGame installer misplaces the templates for Visual Studio 2015 (full release).
The correct output folder is 

C:\Users\user\Documents\**Visual Studio 14**\Templates\ProjectTemplates\Visual C#

And MonoGame installs to

C:\Users\user\Documents\**Visual Studio 2015**\Templates\ProjectTemplates\Visual C#

This causes the templates to not show up, even when Visual Studio 2015 is selected in the installer.

data.title: TextureCube support in MonoGame pipeline
data.body:
TextureCube objects do not appear to be supported by the MonoGame pipeline.  When passing a multiple face dds file into the pipeline, the result, at load time, is a Texture2D object instead of a TextureCube.  

This issue appears to have been previously discovered at http://community.monogame.net/t/loading-cubemaps-generated-with-monogame-pipeline/1025 but an issue was never recorded

data.title: MGCB can't handle malformed Fonts in the Windows Registry
data.body:
I tried to add a simple font to my project and got errors while building it. I tracked the issue down to the following [line](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Processors/FontDescriptionProcessor.cs#L208) After analyzing my registry, i saw that some of my entries have invalid data. All of them have completely uppercase Names, as you can see in the image. The data in these registry entries look like ARIAL.TTF\00\0\0\0\0\0 As craftworkgames pointed out, these could be some kind of line endings. I don't know what made (corrupted?) the data look like this, but i just updated my machine to Windows 10. Replacing the invalid characters could solve this, because these fonts exist in my Fonts folder and other programs can access it. ![corrupted](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4223452/9147856/8d880c6a-3d6d-11e5-8e30-77da796a98ce.png) Here is the corresponding [Stackoverflow Question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31886866/invalid-path-while-processing-font-with-mgcb/31887410) The stack trace: 

default.spritefont: error: Processor 'FontDescriptionProcessor' had unexpected failure! System.ArgumentException: Illegales Zeichen im Pfad.
bei System.IO.Path.CheckInvalidPathChars(String path, Boolean checkAdditional) bei System.IO.Path.IsPathRooted(String path)
bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.FindFontFileFromFontName(String fontName, String fontDirectory)
bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process(FontDescription input, ContentProcessorContext context)
bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process(Object input, ContentProcessorContext context)
bei MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent)
How to reproduce: - Look inside your registry at SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Fonts - Search for a completely uppercase Entry - Try to build with this font. I'm sorry for my bad English. When i forgot something, please let me know.

data.title: Windows 8/10 input panel fixes
data.body:
Hide input panel when tapping outside textbox (Microsoft QA requirement)
Fixed input panel background color when not focused (was black, which made it hard to see)
Cleaned up input panel button style (padding was messed up, lot of code for nothing)

data.title: Linux installer does not install required files for MGCB build
data.body:
I have recently found that the Linux installer does not install any of the files required to automagically build and copy all of a project's content using a MGCB file. It is missing (at minimum) the `MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets` file, and even now that I have that in a place where xbuild can find it, it does not seem to be building the content or copying it, though MonoDevelop is no longer complaining that it is missing the `.targets` file.

Could I get a fix for this? I don't know what else could be missing.

Note: I wrote a blog post about installing the `.targets` file to the correct place on the system, which you can find here: http://dylanwilson.net/automatic-content-building-on-linux-with-monogame

data.title: Added Content Pipeline Extension Project
data.body:
Added a project for creating a content pipeline extension, refrences assemblies from the MGCB directory. I could not provide a Icon since I cannot draw at all.

Fixes #3164.

data.title: Reverting audio changes (#4010) due to bug on Windows 7 (#4045)
data.body:
There seems to be a problem when using DX11.1 and 11.2 on Windows 7:
http://sharpdx.org/forum/5-api-usage/3334-xaudio2-unable-to-load-dll-xaudio2-8-dll

This commit reverts the requirement for the newer version of DX, and just uses DX11.
This should now work on both Windows 7 and Windows 8.

The dependencies uses my revision, but before it is pulled, I'll change it.

See issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4045

data.title: MonoGame PCL for v3.4 or develop
data.body:
Hey MonoGame team,

I'm working on [MonoGame.Extended](https://github.com/craftworkgames/MonoGame.Extended), which provides/will provide extensions such as cameras, GUI, etc, and ran into an interesting issue. We are compiling our core library as a PCL against the MonoGame PCL available on Nuget, and this limits us to old versions of MonoGame (the most recent being v3.2.99.1-Beta, two major versions behind). Many changes have been made since then, and even being able to use v3.4 would be a ton better. Can I get some directions on how to build MonoGame as a PCL, and/or an update to the Nuget package?

data.title: [Win Pipeline] Use window color for menubar if on Windows 10
data.body:
Just thought it looked a bit ugly, had to change it...

For the question why didn't I use "System.Environment.OSVersion" to check if the OS is Windows 10, that's easy to answer, that would give me a result of Windows 8:

> Applications not manifested for Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 will return the Windows 8 OS version value (6.2). 

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-ca/library/windows/desktop/ms724832(v=vs.85).aspx

data.title: Fixed DesktopGL Fullscreen
data.body:
Fixes 2 things:
1) Not being able to switch fullscreen during runtime in all DesktopGL platforms
2) WindowsGL not beeing able to enter fullscreen, was using wrong code for fullscreen in GraphicsDeviceManager.cs which made it not able to enter fullscreen

data.title: Unexpected token error on in Effect file
data.body:
Hello everyone,

I'm porting some old XNA code over to MonoGame and I'm getting the following errors:

```
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(250,51) : Unexpected token '2' found. Expected CloseParenthesis
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(250,51) : Unexpected token '2' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(250,51) : Unexpected token '2' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(264,51) : Unexpected token '3' found. Expected CloseParenthesis
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(264,51) : Unexpected token '3' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(264,51) : Unexpected token '3' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(278,45) : Unexpected token '5' found. Expected CloseParenthesis
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(278,45) : Unexpected token '5' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(278,45) : Unexpected token '5' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(293,45) : Unexpected token '7' found. Expected CloseParenthesis
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(293,45) : Unexpected token '7' found. Expected CloseBracket
C:\Users\Michael\Git\gbh2dev-face-mg\gbh2dev\Content\Shadow.fx(293,45) : Unexpected token '7' found. Expected CloseBracket
```

The corresponding lines look like this:

``` C
PixelShader = compile ps_5_0 ShadowTermPS(2);
PixelShader = compile ps_5_0 ShadowTermPS(3);
PixelShader = compile ps_5_0 ShadowTermPS(5);
PixelShader = compile ps_5_0 ShadowTermPS(7);
```

The full file is available [Here](https://gist.github.com/FaceHunter/be81d8e8a8c468dd96f0)

I have no idea what's causing this and it looks like correct syntax to me.

Thanks in advance,
FaceHunter

EDIT: the same error occurs in another file, also with `PixelShader = compile ps_5_0 SomeFunction(true);` only with true and false

data.title: Removed old OpenTK GamePad code
data.body: Cleanup from #3632 since there is a Joystick API

data.title: Removed call to GetExecutingAssembly in ContentTypeReaderManager
data.body:
Removed call to GetExecutingAssembly in favour to use the Assembly property of Type.

Fixes #4047

data.title: Only write out GL extensions to Application Output if it's a DEBUG build
data.body: It really clogs up application output to have to always see all the possible GL extensions.

data.title: Fixed sample length for SoundEffect.FromStream (Windows DirectX)
data.body:
SoundEffect.FromStream is currently using the wrong sample length (in the Windows DirectX build). It's currently using the length in bytes, when it needs to use the length in samples. The effect of this is that sound effects loaded with FromStream play for too long (and usually end up playing bits of other sound effects).

There was some code correcting for this at some point, but this was removed in PR #3638 because XNB sound effect lengths are already specified in samples.

So this PR calculates the correct length in samples only when using SoundEffect.FromStream. It won't affect loading of XNB sound effects.

data.title: error x5426 - compiler says too many operations for ps_2_0 when using ps_4_0...
Remove GetExecutingAssembly() Call
data.body:
We should remove the call to `GetExecutingAssembly()` here:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentTypeReaderManager.cs#L55

And replace it with the `WINRT` version which should work on all platforms and is much less expensive to execute.

data.title: Fixup for DesktopGL Exit errors
data.body:
Fixes: #3540

Stuff done:
- Fixes BadWindow, BadCursor and OpenTK: Failed to make context current errors
  - was occurring because of window getting Disposed before the rest of the things completed like disposing of Textures(which require a valid window handle), to fix it I close the window at the end of platform.Dispose() so that everything could complete correctly before exiting.
- Fixes AL Sources Error
  - whoever wrote the code didn't dispose of the sources at the end... nothing major
- Fixes AL Device Not Closed error
  - was occurring because of the BadWindow and BadCursor errors were stopping dispose from completing
- Fixed native stacktrace error
  - was occurring because of _toolkit.Dispose()... it's an error within OpenTK, but since _toolkit was an unused variable I just removed it

data.title: Sound effects no longer work under Windows 7 (DirectX)
data.body:
PR #4010 has caused a regression - Sound effects no longer work under Windows 7 (for the DirectX build).

Further investigation reveals that SoundEffect(.XAudio).InitializeSoundEffect was swallowing an exception about being unable to load "xaudio2_8.dll". I found a post on the SharpDX forums discussing this issue (http://sharpdx.org/forum/5-api-usage/3334-xaudio2-unable-to-load-dll-xaudio2-8-dll). Long story short - It seems you need to use the DirectX11 SharpDX libraries for Windows 7. The DirectX11.1/11.2 libraries don't seem to be fully supported under Windows 7.

I did a quick hack to prove this by copying the SharpDX 2.6.3 DirectX11 libraries in. I also had to revert the changes made to SoundEffect.XAudio.cs after I did this to get it compiling. Sound effects started working again with these changes.

I'm more than happy to make a pull request for this. But I wasn't sure whether to use the SharpDX "DirectX11-net40" or the "DirectX11-Signed-net40" libraries though...

data.title: Correct fix for MediaFactory.GetService failure
data.body:
This should be the correct fix for the MediaFactory.GetService failure and related volume problems\* in the Windows DirectX build (See PR #3255 / Issue #2620). This PR may possibly also resolve issue #1954.

(\* I was having a problem where after the first song was played, volume changes were not taking effect until the next song was started)

The problem is that GetService cannot be called until the session topology is ready. According to the SharpDX documentation (http://sharpdx.org/documentation/api/m-sharpdx-mediafoundation-mediasession-settopology), when the session is currently paused or stopped, the MediaSession.SetTopology method doesn't even take effect until the next call to Start. And because the method is asynchronous, you need to wait until you receive a "SessionTopologySet" event anyway to know that it's completed.

So I've changed the code to listen for this event. I've tested this on Windows 7 64-bit and it seems to work as expected now (i.e. no crashes on GetService, and volume changes take effect immediately).

PS. A similar fix will also likely be required for VideoPlayer.WMS as it uses the same methods, but I wanted to focus on MediaPlayer first as this is what I was having issues with and could test.

data.title: [Win Pipeline] Fixed argument passing
data.body: Fixes #3230, credit to @nkast for the fix

data.title: Strange texture edge bleeding when upgrading a year old game to MonoGame
data.body:
I'm getting this strange texture edge bleeding effect after upgrading a year old game to the latest version of MonoGame:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/504826/9023721/19c6ff60-38eb-11e5-93fd-3b1f85a37923.png)

I used to do:

```
this.GraphicsDevice.SamplerStates[0].Filter = TextureFilter.Point;
```

in LoadContent, but that is no longer permitted, so I changed it to:

```
this.GraphicsDevice.SamplerStates[0] = SamplerState.PointClamp;
```

and started performing this before rendering all of the textures.  Everything looks almost correct, but there's 1 pixel of edge where it's off (and it's always one pixel, no matter how close you are to the texture).

Is there something else I need to change or upgrade to get it to look the way it used to:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PIPKPxc1KPI

data.title: Trim DXGI device when suspending on UWP as required by app cert kit
data.body:
This was not added during transition the to W8.1 (#2204). I don't know if these things are in the right place, but they make it possible to pass the app cert kit.

It would be also great to add similar code to the Windows 8 version as officially it is also required there.

data.title: "Couldn't find a default importer" loading text files with the Content Pipeline
data.body:
I'm trying to use the Content Pipeline to add a text file to my project (I'm planning on storing my level designs as plain text). When I try and build the project though, I get this error:

`C:/Users/Tamsin/documents/visual studio 2013/Projects/Bambuzle/Game1/Content/Levels/1.txt: error: Couldn't find a default importer for 'C:/Users/Tamsin/documents/visual studio 2013/Projects/Bambuzle/Game1/Content/Levels/1.txt'!`

If it matters for anything, the contents of the text file look like this:

```
########
########
########
########
########
########
01000010
.700007.
.2....2.
.700007.
.307706.
........
```
